#cultivatecommunityrelationships
shared_text:
Conway Area Chamber of Commerce
August 7 at 5:09 PM ·

Each August, dozens of businesses set up booths to welcome Conway’s teachers back to school as part of the Teacher Breakfast and Education Fair, presented by Conway Corporation and Kimberly-Clark. The 16th annual event will look different, but the purpose remains the same – honoring the educators in our community and giving businesses the opportunity to reach a captive audience.

In lieu of an in-person event, our team stuffed 1,300 teacher appreciation bags filled with items from 50 participating businesses. Each educator from Conway Christian School, St. Joseph School, and Conway Public Schools will receive a bag.

Many of the participating businesses will host giveaways on social media using the hashtag #BackToSchoolConway. We encourage teachers and support staff to use the hashtag to interact with these businesses for a chance to win prizes! Teachers, check out the comments for a list of participating businesses.

Tag a Conway teacher or support staff member in the comments to thank them for all they do! 👇

This year's National History Day competition was held virtually, and two students from Conway Junior High School won awards!

Congratulations to these outstanding students!

Kindergarten Registration for the 2020-21 School Year is officially OPEN.

If your child will be 5 on or before August 1st this year, it’s time to go online and register for Kindergarten! Registration is ONLINE ONLY. Go to our website—conwayschools.org—find your zoned building, then fill out the registration forms- on your computer or mobile device. http://www.conwayschools.org/new-student-registration.html

Everyone will need to create a new login for Kindergarten registration- even if you have existing students in Conway Schools. You DO NOT use your CPSD Parent login for Kindergarten Registration.

At the end of the online registration you’ll be prompted to make a registration appointment at your school. A list of the documentation you’ll need to bring with you is also found on our website. These appointments will be handled with appropriate social distancing and safety measures. Please email registrationhelp@conwayschools.net if you have questions.

October 10, 2019 at 10:05 AM · Conway, AR ·

Woodrow Cummins Elementary was selected as the 2019 Grant Recipient for Red Ribbon Week! Sheriff Tim Ryals and Chief Deputy Matt Rice were happy to present a check for $951.18 to Counselor Sara Moore and students this morning from the Arkansas Sheriff's Association !

Red Ribbon Week is an alcohol, tobacco, drug, and violence awareness campaign that is observed annually in October.

Red Ribbon Week began after the murder of DEA agent Enrique "Kiki" Camarena in 1985. The events that followed Camarena's disappearance were chronicled in U.S. media, exposing the world of drug trafficking including how far drug traffickers would go to maintain power and control.

For more Information about Red Ribbon Week visit redribbon.org

During the remodel of Theodore Jones Elementary School this past summer, Conway Public Schools took the opportunity to replace the HVAC systems in that school. As part of this system change-out, the district partnered with CenterPoint Energy to take advantage of the energy efficiency incentive programs they offer.

As a result of these efforts, the Conway School District recently received a rebate amount of $24,600 from CenterPoint Energy for the installation of forty-one high-efficiency 95% natural gas furnaces.

In addition to the rebate incentives, the district is expected to save nearly $5,000 annually and $99,876 over a lifetime.

Congratulations to these three Conway Students for winning 1st place at National History Day competition in Washington D.C. last week!

Olivia and Ethan Marotte, both juniors at Conway High School and their brother Simon Marotte, a 9th grade student at Conway Junior High, won 1st place in the nation in the Senior High Group Performance category.

Their national winning performance was on "The Ritchie Boys", a group of US special military intelligence officers who were enlisted men and were trained at Camp Ritchie, Maryland during World War II.

This is only the second time in history that a Conway student(s) have won first place at the national competition.

Congratulations to these three Conway Students for winning 1st place at National History Day competition in Washington D.C. last week!

Olivia and Ethan Marotte, both juniors at Conway High School and their brother Simon Marotte, a 9th grade student at Conway Junior High, won 1st place in the nation in the Senior High Group Performance category.

Their national winning performance was on "The Ritchie Boys", a group of US special military intelligence officers who were enlisted men and were trained at Camp Ritchie, Maryland during World War II.

This is only the second time in history that a Conway student(s) have won first place at the national competition.
